questions.question: ……………………….. being fined, he had his license revoked.
It is ……………………. interesting.
questions.description: When present participles are used as adjectives, we use very with it.

questions.question: I was ………………………….. interested in the lesson.
questions.description: When past participles are used as adjectives, we use much with it.

questions.question: I am ………………………. sorry to hear about your loss.
questions.description: Do not use quite in the sense of very.

questions.question: I have eaten nothing …………………….. yesterday.
questions.description: Since is used before a noun/phrase denoting some point of time, and is preceded by a verb in the perfect tense.

questions.question: I commenced work ……………………. Monday.
questions.description: From is also used to give the starting point of something. It is used with all tenses.

questions.question: I have never seen a more ……………………… match.
